intro: Olearia rugosa, commonly known as the rough-leaved daisy, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its distinctive, showy composite flower heads. The plant features silvery-white, woolly foliage that gives it a soft, textured appearance. Its flowers bloom in spring and summer, producing clusters of small yellow disk flowers surrounded by white ray florets. Olearia rugosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to coastal and well-drained garden soils.
